programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth in Charge: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. But when his new idea backfires, Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager. (S10, ep 3)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Back in Action: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, Les cuts a deal that could set the shop on fire.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Back to the Hustle: Ashley questions whether the pawn store has a thief in its midst when two teens come in with news of a scam. (S10, ep 5)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth Snaps: Ashley's regimental behaviour concerns Les, who thinks she's being a little too rough on Seth. But Seth releases his frustration with a sledgehammer. (S10, ep 6)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Computer Crash: Seth is called upon to repair the malfunctioning computer system while Ashley is left to deal with an irate customer who was given the wrong ring. (S10, ep 7)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: All American Jewelry And Loan: A Christian Reverend sells Seth a rare baseball signed by Babe Ruth for $1,000. But questions soon arise over its authenticity. (S10, ep 8)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Breakdown at Tiffany's: A man brings in a 160-year-old Tiffany watch. But with no official markings on it, will Les be tempted by his $40,000 asking price? (S10, ep 9)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Gold Crash: Les buys memorabilia from the last remaining Bill Knapp's restaurant for $200, but Ashley fears that it won't sell. (S10, ep 10)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Harold's Gamble: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted Audemars Piguet watch from a customer but asks his watch expert take a closer look at it first. (S10, ep 11)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Machine Gun Ton: Ton and Allen battle a pair of vicious female auction hunters who have an axe to grind. (S4, ep 9)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Always Money In Philadelphia: The guys face a shady bidder with inside information and a former NFL star in a battle for a vintage football. (S4, ep 10)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Carolyn Goes Topless: A friendly competition with former employee Carolyn turns into a vicious battle for a 1968 Corvette Stingray. Allen tests out his ninja skills. (S4, ep 11)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Don't Taze Me Bro: Two fierce opponents best Ton and Allen at the auction, leaving the duo in the lurch with a 'trash unit' and little chance of breaking, even for the day. (S4, ep 12)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts investigate evidence suggesting that aliens have created the means for controlling humanity. They find that the shocking truth might be hidden right inside you. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: California: California is home to numerous sightings of unidentified flying objects. The size of the state is a recipe for explained and unexplained sightings. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Crash and Retrieval: The team head to Mexico to the site of an alleged international incident involving the remains of a UFO wreck. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFO Dogfights: The team examines a declassified US Department of Defense report which analyses an alleged encounter between a fighter pilot and a UFO. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Vortexes: The team travels to Sedona, Arizona, long known for strange phenomena, to interview witnesses to unexplained sightings of lights and objects in the skies. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The NASA Files: The team analyses incredible NASA footage of reported UFOs, and interviews former NASA employees who allegedly witnessed cover ups first hand. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An actual UFO military alert took place at Edwards Air Force Base in California, 1965. This is the full story including an interview with the soldier manning the tower that night.

programme.title: UFO Hunters

programme.title: Secrets Of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Edinburgh: A look at one of Scotland's most popular paid tourist attraction. With a slew of sieges to its name, it is no surprise that the site boasts some formidable defences. (1 of 5)

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island

programme.title: New: Secrets Of The Lost Liners

programme.title: New: Medieval Dead

programme.title: New: Traitors

programme.title: FA Cup Live
programme.desc: Aston Villa v West Ham United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the third-round tie at Villa Park. Both teams have gone a long time without lifting this famous trophy, with West Ham's last triumph coming in 1980 and the Villans' all the way back in 1957. However, the hosts in particular will have high hopes of going far in this competition, having made great strides in recent years, and the prevailed 2-1 when the teams met at London Stadium in the Premier League earlier this season. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Mel B and her daughter Phoenix, Jonathan Ross and his daughter Honey, and Richard Madeley and his daughter Chloe compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Mel's faith in Phoenix is brought into question, Jonathan has an outrageous idea for how Honey can turn an impediment into an advantage, and Chloe shares her dad's tendency to expose himself in the Madeley kitchen. Romesh also teaches his mum Shanthi how to deliver bad news to a Spice Girl

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: The fast-paced game of words, hosted by Adil Ray, where three pairs of contestants face Lingo grids, fiendish puzzlewords, and a tense head-to-head round as they battle to reach the final and a chance to win a 15,000-pound jackpot - fighting it out alongside the reigning Lingo champions are twins Caitlyn and Alisha and work colleagues Ajmal and Ian

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Join Stephen Mulhern as Sophena takes her place in the hot seat - will she trust in what's in her randomly selected box, or will she choose to accept an offer from the Banker?

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three more factories producing some of the nation's favourite food-and-drink items. It reveals how millions of Drumstick lollipops are made at the Swizzels sweet factory in Derbyshire, and how the Mackie family produces its famous ice-cream in Aberdeen. There is also a look behind the scenes at the Robinsons squash factory, where orange cordial destined for the Centre Court of Wimbledon is produced. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining six incognito celebrities enter the competition, with Pufferfish, Bush, Wolf, Pegasus, Toad in the Hole and Bear taking to the stage. Special guest Vicky McClure joins panellists Maya Jama, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan and the true identity of one of the disguised famous faces is revealed at the end of the show

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by actor James Buckley and his model wife Clair, while chefs Romy Gill and James Tanner serve up some delicious recipes

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: FA Cup Live
programme.desc: Liverpool v Accrington Stanley (Kick-off 12.15pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the third-round tie at Anfield. The Reds have won this competition on eight occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2021/22 season, and they have not been beaten at this stage since a loss to Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux in 2019. League Two side Accrington earned this plum draw after defeating Swindon Town at home on penalties in the previous round, and this is their first meeting with the Reds since they were beaten 2-0 here at this stage of the cup all the way back in 1956. With analysis from Robbie Fowler and Karen Carney, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Celebrity Lingo
programme.desc: RuPaul hosts as Charlotte Church and Carys Eleri, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom try to use their powers of deduction to fill in the blanks and find the missing words in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The celebrity pairs will be playing for big money for their chosen charities up against the clock and their opponents

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Fern Britton, Iain Stirling and Mark-Francis Vandelli answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chizzy Akudolu, Andrew Pierce, Sonja McLaughlan and Jack Carroll pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show as nurse Chris, HR adviser Laura and school administrator Samantha compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The musical guessing game continues as Joel Dommett welcomes five of the incognito celebrities beack to the stage. Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama, Mo Gilligan and guest panellist Suranne Jones try to deduce their identities before the identity of one of the famous faces is revealed

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna are back to finish their game and have got their sights set on a seven-figure sum. Emotions then run high and there are tears all round as postman David and his partner Aaron take on the Limitless Ladder, hoping to win enough to set themselves up with their perfect family home

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Max is shocked to hear that Meg sees their time apart as a trial separation when he takes up an offer from his sister-in-law Tori to stay with her family in Rose Bay. As the detective tries to win his wife round, he helps the investigation by persuading Abigail to make a public appeal before focusing on finding the off-grid Erica and pursuing a drugs motive and the 20,000-dollar deposit

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: James Bond spoof, starring David Niven, Peter Sellers and Ursula Andress. Agent 007, whose exploits on behalf of his country have resulted in a knighthood, is now enjoying his retirement to the full. But when "M" is killed, Bond is called back into active service to halt the threat of the cash-strapped SMERSH organisation.

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Max is shocked to hear that Meg sees their time apart as a trial separation when he takes up an offer from his sister-in-law Tori to stay with her family in Rose Bay. programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: On The Royal Beat, Kate Thornton takes you to the heart of royal matters and dissects the latest news about the monarchy alongside experts brimming with knowledge.

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three more factories producing some of the nation's favourite food-and-drink items. It reveals the secrets of traditional Lancashire Eccles cakes, using a recipe passed from father to son, jam fit for the Queen's breakfast table and gin infused with exotic natural ingredients at a hi-tech distillery. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The musical guessing game continues as Joel Dommett welcomes five of the incognito celebrities beack to the stage. Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama, Mo Gilligan and guest panellist Suranne Jones try to deduce their identities before the identity of one of the famous faces is revealed

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to West End star Trevor Dion Nicholas and actress Jane Asher, David Domoney has tips with houseplants and artist Ruth Wheeler showcases the art of pyrography. Interiors expert Georgina Burnett takes on an upcycling project to inspire everyone to get crafting, resident farmer Charlie Dodd pops by with her latest additions and brewer Jaega Wise serves up pale ales and IPAs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: FA Cup Live
programme.desc: Tamworth v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 12.30pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the third-round tie at the Lamb Ground. National League outfit Tamworth beat Burton Albion on penalties to reach this stage and are now aiming to be the first non-league team to defeat Premier League opposition in the competition since Luton Town overcame Norwich City in 2013. However, they face a tough test against Spurs, who have struggled for consistency this season, but can be a threat to anyone on their day. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show as nurse Chris, HR adviser Laura and school administrator Samantha compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Wartime comedy based on the BBC TV sitcom, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones. England, 1944: when a glamorous reporter is sent to profile the Home Guard of Walmington-on-Sea, it's not long before romance rears its head. Meanwhile, MI5 has reason to believe a German spy is operating in the town...

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the return of the ice-dancing contest as Anton Ferdinand, Charlie Brooks, Chelsee Healey, Chris Taylor, Dan Edgar, Ferne McCann, Josh Jones, Michaela Strachan, Mollie Pearce, Sam Aston and Steve Redgrave compete to become champion of the rink with the help of some of the world's leading skating professionals. Oti Mabuse and Ashley Banjo are on the judging panel with Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will perform a new routine

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Ant and Dec try to help more contestants climb the never-ending money ladder and first up are husband-and-wife team Dan and Sarah, who would like to buy their first home and build an animal sanctuary for their local community. It's then the turn of married couple Nik and Khajal to take on the Limitless Ladder, with Nik hoping to spend his winnings on a purpose-built barbecue shack, but Khajal's not so sure

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete is questioned by police, but Miles leaks the story to the press, costing him his job. With his life unravelling, Pete realises he must dig into Miles's murky past to save his family. Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Shiv flirts with a barista while celebrating her 36th birthday, but remains determined not to let a man derail her sobriety again and refuses his offer of a date. Meanwhile, Bernie has a new boyfriend and is being lauded for laying off alcohol, much to Shiv's annoyance. Return of the comedy drama, starring Roisin Gallagher

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: At work, Shiv offers to fill in as a teacher for the life-drawing class, but disaster strikes when the model cancels and her stress levels rocket when she bumps into Jack. Meanwhile, Caroline is shocked to discover Rory in a passionate tryst with a colleague, Ant starts to doubt his relationship with Max. and Tom gets the sack

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and his mum Penny, Tony Bellew and his son Corey, and Vicky Pattison and her mum Carroll compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romesh's mum Shanthi's method for getting away with murder

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Jimmy Akingbola returns with the panel show as Gina Yashere, Munya Chawawa, Peter Rethinasamy and Fiona Alle join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to take viewers on a tour of black British history

programme.title: FA Cup Live
programme.desc: Aston Villa v West Ham United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the third-round tie at Villa Park. Both teams have gone a long time without lifting this famous trophy, with West Ham's last triumph coming in 1980 and the Villans' all the way back in 1957. However, the hosts in particular will have high hopes of going far in this competition, having made great strides in recent years, and the prevailed 2-1 when the teams met at London Stadium in the Premier League earlier this season. programme.desc: Mel B and her daughter Phoenix, Jonathan Ross and his daughter Honey, and Richard Madeley and his daughter Chloe compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Mel's faith in Phoenix is brought into question, Jonathan has an outrageous idea for how Honey can turn an impediment into an advantage, and Chloe shares her dad's tendency to expose himself in the Madeley kitchen. Romesh also teaches his mum Shanthi how to deliver bad news to a Spice Girl

programme.title: Lingo

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three more factories producing some of the nation's favourite food-and-drink items. It reveals how millions of Drumstick lollipops are made at the Swizzels sweet factory in Derbyshire, and how the Mackie family produces its famous ice-cream in Aberdeen. There is also a look behind the scenes at the Robinsons squash factory, where orange cordial destined for the Centre Court of Wimbledon is produced. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining six incognito celebrities enter the competition, with Pufferfish, Bush, Wolf, Pegasus, Toad in the Hole and Bear taking to the stage. programme.desc: Mel B and her daughter Phoenix, Jonathan Ross and his daughter Honey, and Richard Madeley and his daughter Chloe compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Mel's faith in Phoenix is brought into question, Jonathan has an outrageous idea for how Honey can turn an impediment into an advantage, and Chloe shares her dad's tendency to expose himself in the Madeley kitchen. Romesh also teaches his mum Shanthi how to deliver bad news to a Spice Girl

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: The fast-paced game of words, hosted by Adil Ray, where three pairs of contestants face Lingo grids, fiendish puzzlewords, and a tense head-to-head round as they battle to reach the final and a chance to win a 15,000-pound jackpot - fighting it out alongside the reigning Lingo champions are twins Caitlyn and Alisha and work colleagues Ajmal and Ian

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Join Stephen Mulhern as Sophena takes her place in the hot seat - will she trust in what's in her randomly selected box, or will she choose to accept an offer from the Banker?

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three more factories producing some of the nation's favourite food-and-drink items. It reveals how millions of Drumstick lollipops are made at the Swizzels sweet factory in Derbyshire, and how the Mackie family produces its famous ice-cream in Aberdeen. There is also a look behind the scenes at the Robinsons squash factory, where orange cordial destined for the Centre Court of Wimbledon is produced. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining six incognito celebrities enter the competition, with Pufferfish, Bush, Wolf, Pegasus, Toad in the Hole and Bear taking to the stage. Special guest Vicky McClure joins panellists Maya Jama, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan and the true identity of one of the disguised famous faces is revealed at the end of the show

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by actor James Buckley and his model wife Clair, while chefs Romy Gill and James Tanner serve up some delicious recipes

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: FA Cup Live
programme.desc: Liverpool v Accrington Stanley (Kick-off 12.15pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the third-round tie at Anfield. The Reds have won this competition on eight occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2021/22 season, and they have not been beaten at this stage since a loss to Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux in 2019. League Two side Accrington earned this plum draw after defeating Swindon Town at home on penalties in the previous round, and this is their first meeting with the Reds since they were beaten 2-0 here at this stage of the cup all the way back in 1956. With analysis from Robbie Fowler and Karen Carney, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Celebrity Lingo
programme.desc: RuPaul hosts as Charlotte Church and Carys Eleri, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom try to use their powers of deduction to fill in the blanks and find the missing words in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The celebrity pairs will be playing for big money for their chosen charities up against the clock and their opponents

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Fern Britton, Iain Stirling and Mark-Francis Vandelli answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chizzy Akudolu, Andrew Pierce, Sonja McLaughlan and Jack Carroll pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show as nurse Chris, HR adviser Laura and school administrator Samantha compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The musical guessing game continues as Joel Dommett welcomes five of the incognito celebrities beack to the stage. Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama, Mo Gilligan and guest panellist Suranne Jones try to deduce their identities before the identity of one of the famous faces is revealed

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna are back to finish their game and have got their sights set on a seven-figure sum. Emotions then run high and there are tears all round as postman David and his partner Aaron take on the Limitless Ladder, hoping to win enough to set themselves up with their perfect family home

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Max is shocked to hear that Meg sees their time apart as a trial separation when he takes up an offer from his sister-in-law Tori to stay with her family in Rose Bay. As the detective tries to win his wife round, he helps the investigation by persuading Abigail to make a public appeal before focusing on finding the off-grid Erica and pursuing a drugs motive and the 20,000-dollar deposit

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: James Bond spoof, starring David Niven, Peter Sellers and Ursula Andress. Agent 007, whose exploits on behalf of his country have resulted in a knighthood, is now enjoying his retirement to the full. But when "M" is killed, Bond is called back into active service to halt the threat of the cash-strapped SMERSH organisation.

Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to West End star Trevor Dion Nicholas and actress Jane Asher, David Domoney has tips with houseplants and artist Ruth Wheeler showcases the art of pyrography. Interiors expert Georgina Burnett takes on an upcycling project to inspire everyone to get crafting, resident farmer Charlie Dodd pops by with her latest additions and brewer Jaega Wise serves up pale ales and IPAs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: FA Cup Live
programme.desc: Tamworth v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 12.30pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the third-round tie at the Lamb Ground. National League outfit Tamworth beat Burton Albion on penalties to reach this stage and are now aiming to be the first non-league team to defeat Premier League opposition in the competition since Luton Town overcame Norwich City in 2013. However, they face a tough test against Spurs, who have struggled for consistency this season, but can be a threat to anyone on their day. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show as nurse Chris, HR adviser Laura and school administrator Samantha compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Wartime comedy based on the BBC TV sitcom, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones. England, 1944: when a glamorous reporter is sent to profile the Home Guard of Walmington-on-Sea, it's not long before romance rears its head. Meanwhile, MI5 has reason to believe a German spy is operating in the town...

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the return of the ice-dancing contest as Anton Ferdinand, Charlie Brooks, Chelsee Healey, Chris Taylor, Dan Edgar, Ferne McCann, Josh Jones, Michaela Strachan, Mollie Pearce, Sam Aston and Steve Redgrave compete to become champion of the rink with the help of some of the world's leading skating professionals. Oti Mabuse and Ashley Banjo are on the judging panel with Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will perform a new routine

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Ant and Dec try to help more contestants climb the never-ending money ladder and first up are husband-and-wife team Dan and Sarah, who would like to buy their first home and build an animal sanctuary for their local community. It's then the turn of married couple Nik and Khajal to take on the Limitless Ladder, with Nik hoping to spend his winnings on a purpose-built barbecue shack, but Khajal's not so sure

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete is questioned by police, but Miles leaks the story to the press, costing him his job. With his life unravelling, Pete realises he must dig into Miles's murky past to save his family. Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay
